intro: Cassipourea kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon cassipourea, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, globose fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
